Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because it states that "half our general revenue goes to education." It is unclear if this statement accurately represents the percentage of general revenue allocated to education in Florida.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that half of the general revenue goes to education. It is not backed up by specific figures or sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that allocating half of the general revenue to education is a significant or problematic issue. This assumption may be subjective and open to interpretation.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the allocation of general revenue to education, such as legal requirements, federal funding, or specific budgetary priorities. These alternative explanations are not explored in the claim.
